channel.title: Compiler Failure
channel.description:
Just started doing servers again.
Tried compiling my compiler, and it says
'The system cannot find the path specified'
Any reason at all?

item.title: Compiler Failure
item.dc:creator: @Gl_Then_Gf Gl Then Gf
item.description:
@Gl_Then_Gf wrote:

okay thanks,

i downloaded my jdk1.6.0_24

its in the java folder.

and i tryed setting my environment variables… but idk if its right… can u tell me the right PATH and CLASSPATH please

Edit- my compiler is working! thanks!!!

plus when i type – ipconfig in my cmd its says its not a external and internal commands etc…

any1 no problem??

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Failure

item.description:
@youdunce2 wrote:

If its not a .CFG file then it doesn’t need to be restarted. But editing java files you need to restart

item.dc:creator: @Gl_Then_Gf Gl Then Gf

do they need a restarter too?

item.title: Compiler Failure
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“Gl Then Gf, post:7, topic:388094”]well, im downloading the jdk update 24 now. So i’ll see if that works… thanks mate for helping.

Btw, can i ask you another question?

  1. When you have compiled, do you have restart the server for the changes to be made??

thanks.[/quote]

The server needs to be shut off while you compile, and then restarted. If you are editing something such as a .cfg file, you only need to restart the server.

Once you download JDK, make sure it is in the Java folder first (directory is on a post above). You’ll need to set your environmental variables and then edit the path inside the compiler. There are a few tutorials on setting environmental variables in the Tutorial Section if you need help.

Read full topic
